body.p: To his Excellency of The Governor of Kentucky

The undersigned citizens of Kent of Union County will respectfully represent to your Excellency that John Albert a former citizens of this county Stands indicted under a charge of Larciny (Stealing a Saddle). we understand the facts to be in Substance as follows. that at a night meeting in this county. Alberts Saddle was taken from his horse & a preachers Saddle was put on in Sead, by Some unknown person influenced by mischief or by design. Albert rode home during the night, & his Servant took charge of his horse, & hid his Saddle as he had been directed to do, as guerillers had been in the habit of taking his Saddle bridles &c. when the next morning man come & asked for the saddle & as explanation given, the Saddle was Sent for by Albert & given up & for which he now stands Indicted. Albert is now absent from this county & though delicacy will never return unless pardoned. we have known him from his infancy to Manhood. he is a gentleman in every respect & is far above the commission of the crime he is charged with. we want him back as a citizen. & we earnestly pray that your Excellency will pardon him & permit him to return to his native country & the act will accord with public Sentament

Hiram McElroy
